intro: Isnardia microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. Isnardia microcarpa is often found in desert scrub and sand dune ecosystems, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
